Story Telling

CloudCheckr/NetApp | Lead Design | 2021

CloudCheckr‘s multiple best practice checks are a valuable differentiator, but their use and management were painful, especially for large customers, as the list grew unwieldy over time.

New Design

I led the collaborative design to improve usability and progressively tell a story with data, allowing users to quickly grasp issue severity and resolve them at scale. The junior designer I mentored designed the graphs and chose colors under my guidance.

Research

User interviews revealed key challenges:

  • Customers disliked the endless list, fearing missed issues.
  • They couldn‘t track if problems worsened or how long issues persisted.
  • They needed scalable solutions, not individual resolutions.

Sketches

Early concept sketches show the evolution of tab graphics into a simpler design.

Legacy Design

The old design featured hundreds of individual checks with separate controls, requiring manual resolution one at a time. Its size demanded excessive scrolling to assess severity.

Telling a Story with Design

My design introduced enhancements for progressive disclosure and scalable manipulation:

Filters enable inclusion or exclusion of Providers or user-defined Tags to focus data.

Small bars above tabs preview volume and severity of issues per category.

The chart narrates trends over time, more insightful than just the current state.

Progress bars with textual metrics preview each severity level.

A control bar manipulates multiple items at scale, saving time when resolving issues.

Each severity level offers a graphic and numeric overview, expanding independently.
